pageContext.claim: “I have just spoken to General Mazloum, a wonderful man, the Commander-in-Chief of the SDF Kurds. And he was extremely thankful for what the United States has done. Could not have been more thankful.”
pageContext.analysis: It’s hard to imagine the General Mazloum was "very thankful" for the draw back of U.S. troops. After the initial announcement, one Kurdish led group called the U.S. withdraw a “stab in the back.” Gen. Mazloum Kobani, commander of the Kurdish-led Syrian Democratic Forces, blamed any potential ethnic cleansing on the removal of U.S. forces.
